original: a'arya pra daksh'a ratna tra y'a n'a ma dh'a ra n'i /
analyzed: a'arya pra daksh'a ratna tra y'a n'a ma dh'a ra n'i /

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog mchog gi rten la bskor ba bya ba'i gzungs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog mchog gi rten la bskor ba bya ba'i gzungs zhes bya ba /
translated: The Dhāraṇī Called Circumambulating the Supreme Jewel

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Śākyamuni.

original: aom na mod sha di ka  k'a la sarba ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: aom na mod sha di ka  k'a la sarba ratna tra y'a ya /
translated: Oṃ namo 'ṣṭa dik kala sarva ratnatrayāya

original: na ma ma pra daksha su pra daksh'a /
analyzed: na ma ma pra daksha su pra daksh'a /

original: sarba p'a pam bi sho dha ni sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarba p'a pam bi sho dha ni sv'ah'a /

original: lan gcig brjod pas phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal zhing bskor ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan gcig brjod pas phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal zhing bskor ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: once, it is as if one has paid homage and circumambulated the Three Jewels of the ten directions and three times.

original: thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i sdig pa thams cad dag par 'gyur /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i sdig pa thams cad dag par 'gyur /
translated: All the negative actions accumulated since beginningless time will be purified.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub myur du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub myur du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will swiftly attain the enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: dgra dang / bgegs kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra dang / bgegs kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be vulnerable to enemies and obstructors.

original: nad dang / gdon thams cad las thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad dang / gdon thams cad las thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be freed from all illnesses and spirits.
The dhāraṇī of circumambulation is complete.
